title: Alexandra Mitroshina
text:
Alexandra Alexandrovna Mitroshina (, born 27 June 1994 in <a href="Petrozavodsk">Petrozavodsk</a>) is a Russian public figure, writer, journalist, radio host and blogger. She is mostly known as one of founders (together with <a href="Alyona%20Popova">Alyona Popova</a>) of a <a href="social%20media">social media</a> <a href="flash%20mob">flash mob</a> against domestic violence in Russia "I did not want to die" (#ЯНеХотелаУмирать).
Biography.
In 2015, Mitroshina graduated from the <a href="MSU%20Faculty%20of%20Journalism">MSU Faculty of Journalism</a> of <a href="Moscow%20State%20University">Moscow State University</a>, and later from the Department of Communications, Media and Design of the <a href="Higher%20School%20of%20Economics">Higher School of Economics</a> in Moscow. Later, she worked and published at <a href="Mail.Ru">Mail.Ru</a> and worked on .
Mitroshina appeared on <a href="Instagram">Instagram</a> in 2016. She now has a blog with more than two million subscribers. Initially being a non-political blogger, Alexandra launched, together with another activist, Alyona Popova, a <a href="flash%20mob">flash mob</a> "I did not want to die" (<a href="hashtag">hashtag</a> #ЯНеХотелаУмирать) to support women's protests against recent laws which decriminalized domestic violence in Russia.
